page.title: 05Devil's Den,Fyfield.
page.content: This ruined{longbarrow}was built in megalithic times. It is said that it was deliberately constructed so that at sunset the stones lined up with a former sacred place and that at one time there was a crescent shaped forecourt. Five stones make up the entrance, which lies between east and south south_east. A ring of broad stones stood half a mile to the south. This unfortunately was destroyed in the 1880's. The fact that these monuments were built so close together suggests that they were all part of the same plan. The surrounding land has indeed remained unchanged for many centuries.
